thread.title: Coweta vs. Cherokee in GHSA Volleyball Elite 8
thread.title_full: Coweta vs. Cherokee in GHSA Volleyball Elite 8

title: Coweta vs. Cherokee in GHSA Volleyball Elite 8
text:
Coweta vs. Cherokee in GHSA Volleyball Elite 8 Saturday, October 24, 2015 Comments 
It’s Coweta County vs. Cherokee County for a chance at the Final Four today. 
Region volleyball champions East Coweta and Northgate hope to embrace the role of underdog in today’s GHSA Elite 8 Volleyball Tournament, each making trips to Cherokee hopes of advancing to the state semifinals. 
The Lady Indians (25-21) travel to Class No. 7 state-ranked Etowah (40- 10) for its state quarterfinal match at 2 p.m. 
Northgate (28-18) also faces a tough matchup while traveling to Class No. 4 state-ranked Sequoyah (23-14) today at 3 p.m. 
Both local lineups advanced this week with respective second-round vic- tories on Tuesday at home. East Coweta defeated tenth-ranked North Gwinnett 3-1 before teams were reseeded by the Georgia High School Association for the Elite 8. The Lady Indians earned the No. 5 seed in the tournament behind Etowah. 
Quarterfinalists in Class by seeds include No. 1 and top-ranked Walton, No. 2 South Forsyth, No. 3 Harrison, No. 6 Norcross, No. 7 Mountain View and No. 8 Peachtree Ridge. 
Seniors Sydney Winters, Dominique Ingram and Peyton Smith, all key members of last year’s Final Four team at East Coweta lead a lineup that includes junior libero Riley Padgett. The rotation in Tuesday’s victory included two freshmen and two sophomores on a younger lineup in 2015 for head coach Amber McClure. 
The Lady Vikings have swept consecutive playoff matches over Druid Hills and Winder-Barrow en route to the Class Elite 8, where Northgate is seeded sixth among the remaining eight teams. 
Area 4- had four state-ranked teams headed into the postseason, with only Ola surviving two rounds of playoff action. 
Top-ranked Columbus and No. 2 state-ranked Cambridge enter the the Elite 8 tournament as the top-seeded teams. Sequoyah is ranked third, followed by Dunwoody, Allatoona, Northgate, Harris County and Ola. 
Sequoyah hasn’t dropped a set during state tournament play.Northgate’s roster includes four senior starters including middle hitter Savannah Moore (185 kills, 133 blocks), outside hitter Taylor Richard (287 kills, 191 digs) and defensive specialists Jordan Scruggs and Cara Rhoad. Juniors Katie Stanton (251 kills), Morgan Marshall and Kia Thomas have all made contributions. More
